title: Vocabulary and Idioms Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of vocabulary and idiomatic expressions with this quiz. Answer questions related to synonyms, antonyms, idioms, and more to enhance your language skills.

items.question: Which of these words is not a synonym of 'pensive'?
Fill in the blank: 'He was so _______ that he couldn't even remember his own name.'
What is the meaning of the phrase 'to be at sixes and sevens'?
choices: to be in a state of confusion
to be in a state of agreement
to be in a state of happiness
to be in a state of sadness
items.answer: to be in a state of confusion

items.question: Which of these words is the opposite of 'gregarious'?
Which of these words is not a type of precipitation?
What is the past tense of 'sing'?
What is the meaning of the idiom 'to bite the bullet'?
choices: to face a difficult or unpleasant task
to run away from a difficult or unpleasant task
to talk about a difficult or unpleasant task
to ignore a difficult or unpleasant task
items.answer: to face a difficult or unpleasant task
